html:
5.8.21  10:02 pm   I notice that some of your Jazz songs are 5+ minutes long, did you just put loops or improvs? Whatever it is, It sounds really cool.

      the form is looped and i just jam over it forever. those are basically just leisurely practice exercises

5.8.21  8:45 pm   hey bill! i have this kinda old song that ive been trying to work on, and i cant for the life of me figure out a bridge/new part for it, and i feel it needs something.
its a slow thing kinda r&b-ish, and it chord plays for one bar:
the verses are a Cmaj7 - Am7 - Dm7 - F/G loop, and the chorus is Fm7 - Em7 - Am7 - Dm7 x2 coming right after the Dm7 in the last bar of the verse, and after the chorus theres a transitional F/G to return to the verses.
so far i have a verse/chorus/verse/chorus structure and i want to write a bridge after that 2nd chorus, but then i would like to somehow arrive to a Fm7 to have a 3rd and final chorus/ending kinda thing. any recommendations? ideas? 

     i think it's time to start thinking about melodies, words, etc... 'how the song goes', etc, and not just chords

5.8.21  7:20 pm   what's the story behind the bread at the end of 7.1.14 tuesday video?

      there's a timid beat at the end of the song, so i looked around the room for available props, and the bread was the perfect fit

5.8.21  6:36 pm   Hey bill. So I've read a lot of other questions about writing melodies/lyrics at the same time. I have applied it and got some nice verse melodies with lyrics I like too.  But now I'm in a predicament with the second verse. Now I'm kind of back to trying to puzzle piece lyrics into the preexisting verse melody. I've tried to come up with a new melody/lyrics but then it seems too unrelated to the beginning. So what's the technique for getting around this/ what do you do to help with writing second verses are things like them? Thank so much!!

      anything can happen, but the only way you're gonna get the answers is if you can trick your brain to stop worrying about it. which gets more and more difficult the more you care. which, if you're like me, is a lot. Also the time when you're gonna get the right answer is gonna be after you've heard the whole thing through from the beginning up to the stopping point, in real time. what i would recommend is, record a run-through of what you have, then play some sort of calming sound-free game whilst listening to the recording. and don't be alarmed if you don't seem to get ANYTHING. you'll just have to wait a little longer until your brain actually calms down and until you actually are not thinking about it. then, plentiful answers will flow like water. then the race is on to catch them all in time

5.8.21  6:23 pm   Have you ever made waltz-style music?

     sure

      If no, have you thought of making waltz music?

      yes

5.8.21  5:12 pm   what does the "oh no wear is my pink tutu" on the 404 page mean?

      oops no webpage here

5.8.21  5:05 pm   In your last song (got some money), I really really love the rythm and harmony when you say "got some money (etc.)" in various parts of the song. My question is: can you tell me what chords are you using? I'm not capable of figuring all of them out on my own :/. And if you won't do it, thank you anyways for your contribution to the world of music. Bye! =)

      try F#min first, then C#7 (over F#) then F#min7, then F#min6. but this only works on the first and 3rd lines. all the other times when it says 'money' are gonna be different than that, due to starting in a different key and/or having different chords after the first chord

5.8.21  4:23 pm   what are you thinking about right now

      how to sort lua tables

5.8.21  3:23 pm   when i heard I'm A Princess for the first time and it got to the bit about the door that put a big smile on my face because i remembered how often you had talked about doors on this page. i know that song was written and recorded largely before you started talking about doors a bunch,

     that can't be true, i've been talking about doors for decades and that song was written and produced in 2019

     but i'd still like to ask: do the songs you work on inspire the answers you give? other way around? coincidence?

      they are both inspired by my general experiences out in the world

      it depends on your level of contentment with the status quo

5.7.21  8:37 pm   what is the origin of life

5.7.21  8:04 pm   Hearing your thoughts on 12TET and your experiments with just intonation was really cool! Have you done any similar tinkering with tuning systems like 19TET, 24TET, etc?

     yes

     I'm really interested to try and experiment with them myself but I'm having difficulty figuring out how to do that in a way that isn't weird.

You can use a normal midi-controller to try to make 24TET music, but doing that for any extended period of time seems like it would be confusing to work with if you're somebody who already has normal 12TET piano muscle memory. Without hardware made for microtones or a standardized system of notation it seems like a difficult thing to incorporate into the existing system. What are your thoughts on all of this?

      i don't like the way it sounds

5.7.21  6:31 pm   Why is your music reminiscent of my train of thought? 

      could be the down-to-earth themes

5.7.21  4:06 pm   I never feel like my music is truly great. I mean, I like my music, but I never feel like my music is something that someone would hear and feel powerful emotions that would make them want to listen to it repeatedly. Do you ever feel this way? How could you go about creating music that would make a person feel intensely?

      you are going to have to think about it less, while doing it more

5.7.21  12:13 pm   For how long have you been a duck?

      0 seconds

5.7.21  11:13 am   Any tips for transcribing drum parts of songs?

      get a solid understanding of time. beats per bar, ticks per beat. i can recommend this popular counting system:
     "1, 2, 3, 4" "1 & 2 & 3 & 4 &" "1e&a2e&a3e&a4e&a"
     then you can use that as like an address system. then you'll be able to hear any note in time and understand whether it's on the "& of 4", or maybe the "a of 2", or perhaps the "e of 3"

5.7.21  10:38 am   do you make some lyrics in your songs seem to have a meaning but they have no meaning at all?

      i try to make it have as much meaning as possible

      i can climb a ladder very high. does that count

5.7.21  1:05 am   bill I need ur help learning piano, so far I can name every key on the keyboard, and can build major and minor chords (uninverted) just by listening to the other keys. I don't know what I should learn next, but I'm very interested in knowing how to improvise in every key AND being able to transcribe those chords for other people to play

      i think it's time to get into songs. you can do the melody of the songs, or the chords, or the bass. you can choose. i think you are ready for any one of those 3
